channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: ComfortDelGro starts food delivery service to help cabbies earn extra income
item.description:
April 29, 2020 11:32 AM

SINGAPORE - Taxi giant ComfortDelGro is muscling into the booming food delivery business with ComfortDelivery, which capitalises on the company's fleet of around 10,000 cabs to make deliveries for food and beverage outlets.

item.title: SAF resumes parachute training after 4-month suspension due to training incident
item.description:
April 29, 2020 11:31 AM

SINGAPORE - After a four-month suspension due to a training incident, the Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) has resumed parachute jump training involving cords on Tuesday (April 28), but with new safety measures.

item.title: Man fined $1,500 for leaving home about 30 minutes before coronavirus quarantine ended
item.description:
April 29, 2020 10:43 AM

SINGAPORE - From a bak kut teh meal to that must-have breakfast fare, timing is everything when it comes to food cravings and measures introduced to stem the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: Man hurled vulgarities at cop, threatened to hurt enforcement officers
item.description:
April 29, 2020 10:25 AM

SINGAPORE - A 53-year-old man hurled vulgarities at a police officer on April 14 after he unlawfully met another person in Whampoa.

item.title: Coronavirus: Crying elderly woman, jobless man with strained family ties among callers to National Care Hotline
item.description:
April 29, 2020 10:14 AM

SINGAPORE - The elderly female caller was crying when she called in to seek support, saying repeatedly that she needed a specific spice from the supermarket.

item.title: More than 6,600 calls to National Care Hotline, 500 volunteers have stepped up so far: Desmond Lee
item.description:
April 29, 2020 9:47 AM

This means there have been about 380 calls a day, of which just above 40 per cent, are channelled to the hotline's trained professionals.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on April 29
item.description:
April 29, 2020 7:49 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Wednesday, April 29.

item.title: First 14 days most critical for vulnerable Covid-19 patients
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

The first 14 days of illness are the most critical for those who are more vulnerable to the disease, the Ministry of Health's director of medical services Kenneth Mak said yesterday.

item.title: New roles as safe distancing ambassadors for some workers amid job disruption due to Covid-19
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

For the past three weeks, Mr Richard Lim and his wife have been sleeping in separate rooms.

item.title: Unwell foreign workers to be isolated even before Covid-19 test
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Foreign workers living in dormitories with high rates of coronavirus infection are immediately isolated from others if they display symptoms, even if they have yet to be tested for the virus.

item.title: Out for a run? PUB's robots will remind you to keep your distance
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Water agency PUB has a new kind of safe-distancing ambassador on the ground.

item.title: Psychology, rehab among allied health services reclassified as essential
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

With the extension of the circuit breaker to June 1, the Ministry of Health (MOH) has re-categorised allied health services outside of the public healthcare institutions as essential services with effect from today. These include rehabilitation or therapy services, and other allied health services such as dietetics, social work, psychology and podiatry.

item.title: NTUC website back online after system upgrade
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Online applications for the Self-Employed Person Income Relief Scheme (Sirs), which are made through the National Trades Union Congress (NTUC) website, reopened at around 7.30pm yesterday after the page was taken offline for most of the day to upgrade its system.

item.title: Use of different tests for coronavirus being explored here
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore is exploring the use of a variety of different tests for the coronavirus, the multi-ministry Covid-19 task force said at a media conference yesterday.

item.title: Student-athletes far from sitting back at home
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

When the circuit breaker extension to June 1 was announced, swimmer Maximillian Ang could not help but feel disappointed.

item.title: Singapore ramps up facilities, manpower for coronavirus battle
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore will have far more capacity both inside and outside of hospitals to deal with Covid-19 patients, as it goes about ensuring that the healthcare system can meet the demands imposed on it by the outbreak.

item.title: Singapore's Covid-19 death rate low, but seniors vulnerable
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Among those who are 80 and older who tested positive, about one in five has not survived the virus infection.

item.title: Coronavirus: No relaxing for recruits while BMT is on hold
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Basic military training (BMT) might have been suspended for more than two weeks now, but Recruit Emir Ilyas Elham, 18, is not taking this period to relax.

item.title: 10 must-reads for today
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Water agency PUB has a new kind of safe distancing ambassador on the ground. Called the O-R3, it is an autonomous robot originally used for surveillance at Bedok Reservoir.

item.title: Coronavirus: More stringent testing needed for nursing home staff, new residents
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Several residents at nursing homes and shelters for the vulnerable have been infected by the coronavirus - a matter of particular concern that needs to be addressed urgently.

item.title: CDL to enhance its rental relief for retail tenants here
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Following the announcement of the extension of the circuit breaker period to June 1 and the tightening of rules on essential services, malls have extended their rental rebates for tenants whose businesses have been affected.

item.title: Coronavirus: Hospitals expanding ICU capacity in anticipation of needs
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Hospitals are ramping up intensive care unit capacity in line with the rising number of Covid-19 patients and the expected number who will need such facilities, Health Minister Gan Kim Yong said.

item.title: Fall in number of people caught flouting safe distancing rules
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

More people are adhering to safe distancing measures, with fewer than 70 caught flouting these rules yesterday, said Minister for the Environment and Water Resources Masagos Zulkifli.

item.title: 3,000 healthcare professionals volunteer to help in coronavirus battle
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

About 3,000 healthcare professionals have signed up to the SG Healthcare Corps since it was launched earlier this month to marshal volunteers in the fight against the coronavirus.

item.title: BTO sales launch in May deferred amid circuit breaker
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

The sales exercise for Build-To-Order (BTO) flats next month will be deferred until further notice, said the Housing Board last Friday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Case tally in community likely to rise with more active screening
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of Covid-19 cases detected in the community is likely to increase in the coming days as the Government steps up active screening.

item.title: Religious leaders pledge to maintain solidarity in crisis
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

While the circuit breaker measures have made physical gatherings virtually impossible, religious groups will continue interfaith learning and understanding through online sharing, seminars and meet-ups.

item.title: 528 new cases - lowest daily increase in nearly two weeks
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Foreign workers continued to account for most of the 528 new Covid-19 cases here yesterday, taking the total count to 14,951.

item.title: SMRT to extend taxi rental waiver
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Not everyone will be matching taxi giant ComfortDelGro's extension of a taxi rental waiver.

item.title: Huge task to get meals to thousands of workers: Minister
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Getting meals to thousands of foreign workers in dormitories was a huge undertaking, particularly in the initial period, National Development Minister Lawrence Wong said yesterday when he addressed the criticism levelled at the food they were given.

item.title: Singapore will look after Chinese migrant workers: Vivian Balakrishnan
item.description:
April 29, 2020 5:00 AM

Foreign Minister Vivian Balakrishnan told his Chinese counterpart Wang Yi yesterday that Singapore will continue to look after the well-being of Chinese migrant workers here, including providing them with the necessary medical care and treatment.
